Job_Title: Evidence Generation Data Scientist or Sr Associate, Data Scientist / Epidemiologist
Job_Description:
['
To plan and execute Observational Research using Real World Data to answer key question regarding our therapeutic areas.', '
Generate Scientific Evidence from internal and external databases, both private and public.', '
To contribute Observational Research strategies to achieve ACI Evidence Generation goals cross-functionally.', '
Map, identify and access the best RWD (Real World Data) sources to enable RWE (Real World Evidence) tactical plan.', '
Execute and manage descriptive epidemiologic studies to characterize the incidence/prevalence and distribution of diseases, the natural history and clinical burden of disease, cost and utilization patterns, and the safety and effectiveness of therapies.', '
Execute and manage research projects involving the analysis of multiple types of data including medical claims, EMR and prospective observational cohort studies.', '
Ensure compliance to all internal and external rules regarding access to data, publication and development of observational research.', '
Liaising with internal stakeholders concerning data acquisitions, and patient registry development/partnerships, etc. usability and re-usability of data.', '
Conduct literature reviews and preparing research reports for scientific manuscripts.', '
Stay abreast of the latest developments in the field of observational research and drug development.', '
Promote awareness, understanding and use of observational research methods.', '
Confirming selection and appropriate use of suitable database study designs for studies.', '
Partnering with hospitals and clinics to use external information as a way to solve clinical and scientific questions.', '
Partnering with the Access Team to ensure maximum impact of activities to the patient.', '
Design and implement Real World Data (RWD) studies to generate Real World Evidence (RWE).', '
Providing strategic direction to address complex health outcomes challenges.', '
Defining and shaping research with partners and/or vendors to produce high quality research results.', '
Cooperate with IT departments to correct and efficient health care data warehousing.', '
Keep updated with current trends in data science applied to health outcomes evaluation.', '
Background in medical informatics, epidemiology and/or statistics', '
3+ years’ experience with data science, focus in health care data', '
Medical / Scientific research experience', '
Experience in handling large datasets', '
Experience in the design, execution and analysis of observation research studies within Pharmaceutical and/or Public Health settings', '
Experience in observational research project planning and management', '
Experience working in multi-disciplinary teams', '
Strong knowledge of the scientific method and observational research methods', '
Good statistical methods knowledge', '
Knowledge on public health care databases and how to handle them', '
Data science tools: R, STATA, SPSS or Python', '
Demonstrates strong knowledge in SQL, data handling, warehousing and analysis', '
Demonstrates strong project management and presentation skills', '
Good knowledge of clinical research, drug safety, legal and compliance environment', '
Willingness to continuously expand medical, scientific, market and industry knowledge']

Strong history of publications in HCI or related fields', '
Excellent written and oral communication skills', '
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to new situations', '

['
High performance and ambition. We have a seasoned leadership team, a self-sustaining business, and a clear path on how to keep accelerating. We are looking for talented people to join us on the next phase of our growth.', '
Innovation. We have unlocked the power of data hidden behind bank walls for 65 years by giving customers a little extra for making everyday purchases. Our focus is on creating value through personalization, AI, machine learning, and big data. We are thinking and executing bold and ambitious goals.', "
Trust and professionalism. We have a common goal and everyone pulls their weight and jumps in where they are needed. Trust, respect for each other, and good balance is critical to the core of our company and won't be comprised.", "
Intellectual stimulation and impact. We are one of the few companies doing what we do with data-driven insights. It's exciting to be the first in a role, to work directly with co-founders, and to learn from experts in their field. This is your chance to research, apply, and test new data science, active learning, and ML strategies. You will develop algorithms that support product modelling and extract behavioural insights from our massive data set; adding value to our B2B and B2C customer bases.", '
A challenge culture. You want to be part of a team where your suggestions are expected, challenged, and applied. You want to be part of the conversation; a place where you can figuratively raise your voice and literally go grab lunch together. You will collaborate closely with technical and non-technical team members in an Agile environment; ensuring the insights you derive are aligned with business goals and objectives.', '
Professional satisfaction. You want to take an entrepreneurial approach, analyzing information, solving problems, building relationships and having fun doing it all. You have the grit needed to venture into uncharted territory; to build out our data science and automation capabilities. You want to grow your career with us, and you are eager to step up and make this happen.', "
The education. Ideally, you have a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, data science, analytics, or a related field or have the equivalent practical experience.", '
Technical expertise. You have 3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist and are skilled with TensorFlow, Keras, scikit-learn, NumPy, pandas, and Matplotlib. You are knowledgeable about information retrieval and search engines and have experience with Solr and Lucene. You are familiar with NLP toolkits (Spacy, NLTK), distributed computing platforms (Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Pig, Spark), and databases such as SQL/NoSQL.', "
Communication and collaboration skills. You thrive in collaborative, Agile environments and enjoy working cross-functionally. You're a hands-on, pitch-in-wherever needed person who isn't afraid to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. You share knowledge, voice your opinion, and listen to the ideas of others.", "
The drive. You want to build a great product and are ready to put in the work to do so. You are committed to delivering work that's high-quality and on schedule.", "
Balance. We're at a stage of high growth and we're all hands on deck. With remote working and flexible hours, we trust our teams to get the job done without sacrificing critical personal time.", '
There is a lot of change in the air. We are still building teams, processes, and culture. If you are comfortable with ambiguity and adapting, then Paymi is a rewarding place to grow and make your mark.', "
There's no hierarchy. We're moving from start-up to scale-up. We'll seize moments to create new opportunities for our people based on merit and doing the right thing."]

Job_Title: Head of Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Research
Job_Description:
['
Hires, evaluates, and supervises crew. Provides mentorship and training as necessary to develop crew. Sets performance standards, reviews performance, and makes informed compensation decisions in accordance with all applicable Human Resources policies and procedures.', '
Lead the AI/ML Research team that is in charge of developing innovative ML research techniques, solutions and applications that are meaningful to Vanguard.', "
Supports the continuous evolution and strategy of Vanguard's AI/ML vision, aligning with our Business Solutions team to resolve the best topics and themes for R&D.", '
Own the deployment and socialization of customized ML capabilities, to supports analytical teams across Vanguard, including our Business Solutions team.', '
Evaluates new technologies and manages vendors engaged in AI/ML.', '
Build and manage external relationships with key universities, seeking new and innovative research as well as crafting practices to leverage talent into pipeline.', '
Leads all aspects of the execution of large scale, most complex analytics research. Bring new and innovative ideas to encourage and nurture the culture of applied and theoretical AI/ML R&D.', '
Engage with key business partners to develop a portfolio of POC’s that have positive impact to support Vanguard’s mission.', '
Engages with senior leadership to understand and probe business processes in order to develop hypotheses and own the AI/ML research agenda. Brings structure to requests and translates requirements into a ML approach.', '
Drives innovative analytic applications and results. Keeps abreast of industry, market and company trends, and partners with business leaders to champion the adoption of new data, analytic approaches, techniques and capabilities.', '
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.', '
Minimum of ten years related work experience in analytical roles. Experience with data wrangling required - Programming skills to access, transform and prepare large scale data for statistical modeling. Experience utilizing statistical and machine learning methods required.', '
Undergraduate degree in Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or related analytical field of study or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.']

', 'Manage large volumes of documents and data, and conduct premises checks and offsite interviews. Use your knowledge of open source intelligence gathering and work with OSINT specialists.
', 'Work with data scientists to implement appropriate data analytics/quantitative analyses approaches, tools and methodologies to gain insight into data and determine links and data relationships, conceptualizing, designing and developing applications, and developing algorithms to source, access and track/data/information and evaluate trends and patterns.
', 'Prepare effective case planning, create evidence schedules, conduct pattern analysis, and engage cross-reference tools to assess the validity and relevance of evidence as it is collected.

', 'Provide support to case prosecution/legal actions, prepare and present data analyses, interpretations and reports, and appear as a witness in hearings.

', 'Completion of an undergraduate degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Criminology, Computer Science or other STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) degree .

', 'Law enforcement experience specializing in financial investigations, fraud investigations, money laundering, proceeds of crime, and/or computer evidence analysis.

', 'Strong understanding and knowledge of the capital markets industry, trading products, and role of participants as well as administrative and criminal justice systems, and securities legislation.
', 'Completion of the Canadian Securities Course and/or other related industry courses .
', 'Strong understanding of emerging crypto currencies, crypto assets, crypto platforms and current social media.
', 'Strong project management and problem-solving skills with the ability to demonstrate professional skepticism, resourcefulness, and good business judgment.
', 'Excellent communication skills with the ability to actively listen, probe, and interpret information and to present information orally and in writing coherently, concisely and persuasively .
', 'Excellent inter-personal skills and a demonstrated collaborative and results-oriented style in working effectively both within a team structure and independently, while delivering on expectations in a dynamic environment.

']

Once you pass the first phone screen, we will schedule an on-site team interview, where you will meet with 4-6 members of our team to assess your technical skills, values fit, and cultural add. We may need to ask you a few more questions if there were any areas that needed a bit more expanding.']

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President, Commercial Insurance Pricing Transformation
Job_Description:
['Define a detailed vision of the future P&C rating algorithm. Be able define the objectives of the business based on Pricing priorities and the input of the stakeholders in SME/GCS. Prioritize the various elements of the future state and create a roadmap for execution.
', 'Ensure the transformation plan aligns to the SME and GCS business strategies. Objectives include profitable growth, shifting the mix of business, embedding risk-selection criteria into pricing and enabling frontline underwriters with state-of-the-art pricing tools.
', 'Manage the collaboration with the data science resources. Be able to translate business objectives into the technical requirements for the data scientists. Ensure alignment between resources in pricing and data science to achieve timely execution of the strategy. Define business constraints for predictive modeling.
', 'Identify key milestones for projects and accurately forecast time required to reach those milestones. Review actual progress versus plan, re-forecast and update the stakeholders. Engage stakeholders in order to make timely decisions throughout the development process.
', 'Build a highly-engaged actuarial team. Coach the team and support their growth and independence. Foster a culture of high-performance, collaboration and honest conversations. Ensure recruitment of best talent and proactively manage performance of the individuals on the team.
', 'Track benefits of the implemented changes that demonstrate the success of the implemented changes. Articulate the value of the changes in pricing to the stakeholders in SME/GCS.
', 'Strong focus on risk mitigation and building a risk-aware culture. Ensure adherence to the technical pricing standard and actuarial best practices. Be an advocate for risk management to the direct reports. Be responsible for strong documentation of processes, decisions and methodologies.
', 'Industrialize pricing models in order for them to be repeatable in an efficient and accurate manner. Build controls around modeling process that mitigate possibility of human error.
', "Minimum 10 years' experience in the insurance industry.
", 'Minimum 3 years management experience in commercial insurance pricing.
', 'Fellow of the Casualty Actuarial Society
', 'Strong technical skills in pricing and predictive analytics.
', 'Exceptional attention to detail.
', 'Ability to build a case for change and obtain buy-in from stakeholders.
', 'Ability to influence and negotiate scope, timelines and trade-offs.
', 'Natural people leadership capabilities, engagement with the direct team and peers overall
', 'Ability to attract talent and motivate staff.
', 'Strong communication skills with all levels, including the ability to articulate choice of methodology and the implications of different decisions to non-technical stakeholders.
', 'Ability to think laterally. Able to blend expert-based insights with data-based insights.
', 'Evaluate appropriateness of the different methods and models in each situation.
', 'Awareness of strengths and limitations of different methodologies.
', 'Good knowledge of insurance operations including claims and underwriting
']

['An open mind for new ideas and methodologies – You will develop industry-leading go-to-market capabilities with new customer-centric offerings based on world-class pricing and data science. The team is also accountable for developing and maintaining best-in-class rate adequacy analyses and driving business insights from proactive monitoring. You will embed best practice pricing methodologies leveraging techniques used in other jurisdictions within the Canadian Environment. You will also continually improve the generation of Analysis in terms of length of time to create the reports and the accuracy.
', 'A great team and collaborative work environment – You will work closely with Corporate Actuarial, Claims, Finance Analytics, Underwriting and Government Relations to develop a deep understanding of Aviva’s personal insurance business and reflect key data and emerging trends into our pricing models. You will also work with the analytics group to develop robust and automated monitoring framework.
', 'Advanced pricing and collaboration tools – You will compile, analyze and communicate the health of the portfolio to support regional pricing and business development teams in understanding their mix of business, retention, growth, and overall quality of the book and advising on adjustments as needed. You will also support the Personal Insurance Leadership team in providing actuarial input into the company’s annual business plan.
', 'A culture of personal and professional development – You will monitor and assess the impact of business decision including rate or underwriting changes to ensure the impact is in line with expectations. You will also monitor the market position of Aviva’s pricing relative to key competitor’s impact on the personal insurance portfolio and identify emerging trends which will impact the current book either adversely or positively.
', 'Strong mathematical and statistical background
', 'Strong problem solving and analytical skills
', 'Proficiency in programming and experience in SAS, R, Python and VBA a plus
', 'Ability to communicate well and present ideas/decisions clearly
', 'Adaptability, great teammate and client service skills
', 'Bachelor degree in Actuarial Science, Math or Statistics
', 'Minimum of 2 CAS exams and 2 years of P&C work experience
']

Job_Title: Machine Learning Engineering Technical Lead, Self Driving
Job_Description:
['
Oversee and drive the design, development, testing, and deployment of innovative solutions for challenging problems in the self-driving domain.', '
Ensure robust, scalable, reusable, efficient, production-quality software is being delivered to the organization. Usher and evangelize adoption of engineering best-practices and methodology.
', 'Set the roadmap, drive detailed planning, and ensure execution of deliverables for a small to medium sized team (2-7)', '
Mentor and help bringing up of new team members, help with interviewing and hiring of new team members, ensure technical development of team.', '
Collaborate and communicate closely with researchers to deeply understand the problem space and algorithmic solutions. Design the strategy for deployment in production, communicate to stakeholders, and drive the execution.
', 'Collaborate and communicate closely with cross-site testing, integration, and triage teams to ensure proper delivery and performance of productized models', '
Identify, propose and build tools, utilities, infrastructure, large-scale data and computation pipelines, data storage strategy, common libraries and useful tools needed to optimize research and development of deep-learning models', '
Research and incorporate emerging software infrastructures, tools, and technologies', 'Minimum 8 years experience building production level software systems, preferably with Python and/or C++ (candidates not meeting this requirement but excel in other competencies will be considered)', '
Comfortable developing and working in a Linux environment (or happy to quickly get up to speed)', '
Minimum 3 years experience leading technical teams, designing and architecting complex engineering solutions, planning and roadmapping, documenting, communicating and driving consensus on technical solution across multi-site organizations.', '
A track record of shipping high-impact engineering solutions', '
Experience leading teams working on applied Machine Learning/Self Driving/Robotics/Data Engineering,.', '
Demonstrable track-record of learning and deep-diving as needed into complex existing and new technologies', '
Intense sense of ownership, initiative-taking, and a can-do attitude', '
Great attention to detail and a data-driven approach to problem solving', '
Leadership aptitude with a strong collaboration and communication skills, who is able to motivate and mobilize cross-functional teams, and respond positively to feedback', '
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt easily to meet the needs of our massive growth and rapidly evolving business environment', '
Knowledge of applied machine learning, and in particular distributed training of deep learning models, utilizing GPU processing in compute clusters, recent deep learning and computer vision models, optimization and productization of modern neural networks.
', 'Experience in architecting and building large-scale batch processing pipelines using Big Data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra, etc.', '
Experience with 3D data transformations common in game engines and 3D-graphics programming', '
Familiarity with considerations related to sensor data (RGB, LiDAR) such as calibration, data capturing, noise sources, transformations, etc.', '
People management experience nurturing careers, managing under- and over-performers, influencing cross-functional teams, recruiting and building teams']

Job_Description:
['
Leading delivery P&C work on a wide range of consulting projects within actuarial, underwriting / claims and advanced analytics domains', '
Support practice leaders with new business and sales initiatives. Lead new business proposals, from planning responses, to leading orals to delivering client presentations
', 'Supervising audit engagements and managing actuarial Consultants and Analysts
', 'Staying abreast of technical P&C industry developments like MCT, DCAT, ORSA, etc. as well as leading proposals and engagements in fields such as InsurTech, Advanced Analytics, Robotics Process Automation (RPA), Blockchain and IFRS 17', '
Developing P&C market offerings by contributing with innovative approaches to existing (intra-Firm) initiatives and other proofs-of-concept', '

A minimum of 10 years of relevant actuarial P&C working experience with in disciplines like pricing, reserving, capital management, underwriting and /or analytics', '
Knowledge of actuarial software packages like ResQ, EMBLEM, Radar, ARIUS or Prophet GI
', 'Programming skills (Visual Basic, R, Python, etc.) and visualization tools like Tableau an asset', '

Ability to manage teams and/or engagements with concurrent priorities whilst keeping team members’ moral high', '
An inquisitive, positive mindset topped with a relentless drive to move engagements ahead. When required by business needs, a sense of commitment, ownership and urgency
', '
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.', '
You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.', '
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.']

Job_Title: Innovation Manager (Concept Design)- Canada Goose Innovation Lab
Job_Description:
['Identify opportunities for future innovation initiatives in the context of the overall Canada Goose Advanced Innovation MAP Roadmap
', 'Conduct primary and secondary human insights research through existing methodologies including customer surveys, interview and wear testing protocols
', 'Implement and facilitate innovation tools and frameworks to arrive at a defined innovation business case and brief
', 'Be aware of future trends and cultural movements and link them back to CG.
', 'Liaise and collaborate closely with cross-functional partners and key executive stakeholders to develop, establish and continually evolve our innovation portfolio
', 'Leads and co-leads innovation projects at all stages of the innovation process to enable continual progress towards our delivery commitments
', 'Synthesizes insights across sources and data points and transform them into key conclusions, compelling business stories, and strategic recommendations
', 'Builds, presents and drives-forward innovation business cases which are defined by unique market opportunities in line with Canada Goose’s innovation agenda
', 'Executes and manages timeline around delivery of proof-of-concept innovations including component and system testing in both laboratory and contextual environments (wear testing)
', 'Drives proof-of-concept prototypes to commercialisation through in line partnerships and GTM (Go To Market) process
', 'Identifies and works with relevant world-class vendors and consultants to accelerate our innovation agenda
', 'Participate and present during Goose Advance Innovation Team (GAIT) quarterly updates when requested
', 'Ability to Create graphic representation of proof-of-concept samples
', 'Works with required creative partners to establish visual designs for innovation concepts
', 'Ensures products are engineered to Canada Goose’s Quality and Production standards.
', 'Provides feedback to Design on construction challenges and recommend alternatives or improvements.
', 'Provides information of technical details to Product Developers as required.
', 'Manages and create mock ups with advanced prototyping team in a timely manner when required.
', 'Communicate and liaise with QA of key elements in design and construction.
', 'Work closely with the Advanced Prototype Technician
', 'Design or Industrial Design Education
', 'Undergraduate degree required, advanced degree preferred
', '5 years of professional experience in innovation-based role, ideally with a focus in project leadership on customer-driven design thinking, industrial design, product design/development, digital or graphic design
', 'Experience in product-led brand, particularly in outerwear is an asset
', 'Experience leading high-dynamic teams and cross-functional relationships across a face-paced business
', 'Advanced knowledge of garment construction, pattern making, prototyping is an asset
', 'Strong ability to work from scratch, from first prototype sample through to inline adoption
', 'Clearly communicate with the inline Product Development and Engineering team to ensure successful handover and adoption to the inline collection, including accessibility for feedback and opportunities for key learnings.
', 'Extended knowledge and interests in new construction methods and manufacturing technology
', 'Experience with outerwear garments is an must
', 'Should be organized, detail oriented, team player, multi-task oriented
', 'Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work independently
', 'Ability to prioritize day to day work activities according to the department/business needs and Goose Advanced Innovation Team deadlines and quarterly updates
', 'Ability to work as a team and maintain a high level of professionalism and discretion
', 'Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.
', 'Knowledge of Illustrator helpful
', 'Able to work in a fast-paced environment while meeting the demands of many different departments (Production, Product Development, Cutting, Quality Assurance).
', 'Consistently exhibits Canada Goose’s Values, taking pride in being innovative, respectful, passionate, accountable, and entrepreneurial while exhibiting personal commitment
']

']

Job_Title: Manager, Employee Experience and Leadership Development
Job_Description:
['Developing capabilities that support the new strategy and align to employees’ careers
', 'Creating practices that enhance the employee experience and increase commitment to the company’s purpose
', 'Supporting leaders in growing the workforce of the future
', 'Designing tools that increase employee input into business decisions
', 'Establishing practices that clarify accountabilities and provide guidance so that employees excel
', 'Champion a positive and engaging employee experience throughout the employee life cycle. Develop and implement practices and programs that have a meaningful impact on employees and contribute to business metrics. Examples of practices that the incumbent will lead include:
Orientation: providing employees with the knowledge and tools that will support their successful transition to IESO and validate their decision to join our organization
Employee learning and career growth: assessing and analyzing learning needs, identifying programs and practices, engaging vendors, facilitating, assisting with return on investment, and assessing impact. Establish metrics that inform IESO of appropriate levels of investment in terms of money, time, and programs.
Employee feedback and feed forward programs using pulse checks, surveys, focus groups, etc.
', 'Orientation: providing employees with the knowledge and tools that will support their successful transition to IESO and validate their decision to join our organization
', 'Employee learning and career growth: assessing and analyzing learning needs, identifying programs and practices, engaging vendors, facilitating, assisting with return on investment, and assessing impact. Establish metrics that inform IESO of appropriate levels of investment in terms of money, time, and programs.
', 'Employee feedback and feed forward programs using pulse checks, surveys, focus groups, etc.
', 'Establish leadership programs that are engaging and modern. Use blended learning approaches, assessment, and client input to align leadership practices to IESO’s strategy and values and equip individuals for leading the workforce of the future.
', 'Partner with HRIS team to ensure employee practices and programs are aligned and implemented in the SuccessFactors tool to support an engaging employee experience. This will include knowledge sharing and collaborating cross functionally.
', 'Manage the high potential program and support the Director with succession planning so that IESO has a robust talent pool for future business needs. Approach to this program may include facilitating learning programs, assessing leadership skills, providing feedback, and developing individual growth plans.
', 'Research and recommend frameworks, processes, and practices that enhance employee connection, commitment, and contribution to IESO. Examples include performance planning and measurement, competencies, mentorship, and development planning. Responsibilities include communicating initiatives, collaborating with colleagues, leaders and employees, and situational coaching. Drive decisions and reinforce practices in areas of responsibility.
', 'Establishes communities of practice within the IESO to map out career paths, elevate learning programs, and build technical, interpersonal or business competencies. Demonstrate a client-focused, consultative, and continuous improvement orientation to enhance organizational capability to achieve IESO’s mandate and strategic priorities.
', 'Support IESO in fostering the culture that will support the strategy. Implement change practices that address organizational opportunities and generate employee commitment. Collaborate with the Diversity and Inclusion Committee. Draw linkages between cultural initiatives and business metrics.
', 'Establish measurement and assessment programs to report on:
Organizational performance
Individual performance
', 'Organizational performance
', 'Individual performance
', 'Manage logistics associated with responsibilities including budget, vendor management, procurement processes program set up, and client communications.

', 'University degree in Psychology, Behavioural Sciences, Human Resources or equivalent required.

', 'Knowledge, skill and experience in the following: Leadership Development, Group/Team effectiveness, Career/Development Planning, High Potential programs, and culture
', 'Strong knowledge of psychometric assessment tools
', 'Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain, influence, listen, instruct, give clear feedback, and ask insightful questions
', 'Very strong facilitation skills with a proven ability to bring a group to resolution, decision, or conclusion
', 'Very strong coaching skills gained by engaging in coaching activities with individuals at all levels of an organization
', 'Very strong learning background (especially adult learning theories and practices) with the judgement to determine when learning is (not) the appropriate solution to a situation
', 'Ability to assess organizational or individual situations and determine appropriate practices
', 'Ability to assess business priorities and determine appropriate learning or organizational development intervention

Job_Title: Machine Learning Developer, Digital Products (English Services)
Job_Description:
['
The passion for machine learning and data. You like to experiment and explore bleeding edge technologies and techniques, and validate their effectiveness.', '
The flexibility. You are comfortable with the level of ambiguity these new technologies and projects might bring.', '
The experience. You have strong software development principles and apply them rigorously. You have at least one year experience in building machine learning models and deploying them into production.', '
The education and the technical skills. At a minimum a Computer Science, Engineering degree or equivalent is preferred. Strong Python skills, along with knowledge of machine learning libraries (e.g. Tensorflow) is required for this role, with Java being a great second language to have. You have knowledge or interest in Big Data technologies, NoSQL, Google Cloud Platform, AWS, ETL, Statistics, or academic research.']
